page.title: 11HOUSING, HIGH HAM AND AREA
page.content: There are 172 dwellings within the block, in the villages of High Ham and Aller and the hamlets of Henley, Low Ham and Beer. The vast majority of houses were built between 1850-1900. Blue lias stone is the main building material, with roofs of red pantiles. Modern builders are required to follow this style using reconstituted blue lias stone. 115 of the dwellings are detached; 19 are semi- detached; 7 are terraced; 28 are bungalows and 3 are mobile homes. 7 houses are under construction in 1985. These are 3-4 bedroomed houses which will sell for some Â£70,000. Bowdens has a site for 40 holiday caravans, used for 6 weeks in the summer season. There are several 'listed' buildings dating back to the 16th century,e.g. Manor Farm, High Ham. House names reflect past use:"Wheelwrights","Old School House".
